intro: Spergularia fruticosa, commonly known as sea sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant that thrives in saline and coastal environments. The plant has small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to retain moisture in arid conditions. Spergularia fruticosa is often found in dunes and salt marshes, playing a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
